Di Depan Gedung Sate Bandung, Mahasiswa Protes Rencana Kenaikan Iuran BPJS Kesehatan
05 Nov 2019, 08:09 by Novianti Nurulliah
BANDUNG, (PR).- KAMMI (Kesatuan Aksi Mahasiswa Muslim Indonesia) menolak kenaikan iuran BPJS Kesehatan yang dipastikan berlaku Januari 2020. Penolakan itu mereka sampaikan dalam demonstrasi di depan Gedung Sate, Jalan Diponegoro, Kota Bandung, Selasa 5 November 2019.
Iuran BPJS yang semula Rp 80.000 untuk kelas I menjadi Rp 160.000, kelas ll yang semula Rp 51.000 menjadi 110.000, kelas III yang semula Rp 25.500 menjadi Rp 42.000. Kenaikan dipicu adanya defisit anggaran BPJS Kesehatan.
Dalam spanduk yang KAMMI bentangkan, mereka menuliskan, "Kami Menolak Kenaikan BPJS, BPJS Naik Rakyat Menjerit"
Kordinator aksi Fauzan menuturkan, pemerintah harus bertanggung jawab terhadap defisit BPJS tanpa membebankan kepada masyarakat. KAMMI mendesak Pemerintah Mencabut Perpres Nomor 75 Tahun 2019 tentang Jaminan Kesehatan 3. KAMMI juga mendesak pemerintah memperbaiki pengelolaan dan meningkatkan kualitas pelayanan BPJS Kesehatan.
"Kenaikan iuran BPJS tentu memberatkan masyarakat. Fakta terbaru menunjukkan bahwa terjadi penunggakan pada iuran peserta BPJS Kesehatan karena hanya 50,1 persen dari total peserta mandiri yang rutin membayar iuran, sisanya masih menunggak. Dengan kenaikan iuran peserta BPJS hingga 100 persen, hal itu berpotensi menambah peserta nonaktif dan tentunya akan menambah tunggakan iuran peserta BPJS kesehatan, " ujar dia.
Menurut dia, sebelum berbicara tentang peningkatan premi kepesertaan BPJS Kesehatan, kualitas pelayanan perlu diperhatikan.
"Sampai pada tahap apa pemerintah merangkul seluruh elemen penunjang pelayanan demi tercapainya kualitas kesehatan melalui BPJS Kesehatan seperti. (Banyak) klinik, puskesmas, rumah sakit yang belum melakukan kerja sama dengan BPJS Kesehatan dan bahkan memutus kerja sama," Kata dia.
Hal itu penting diperhatikan karena kesehatan harus dapat diakses oleh seluruh masyarakat berdasarkan UU Nomor 26 Tahun 2009 tentang kesehatan.
Dia mengatakan, menaikkan iuran kepesertaan BPJS Kesehatan sampai pada batas minimal hitungan aktuaria merupakan hal mutlak yang mesti dilakukan karena belum proporsionalnya pemasukan dan pengeluaran dari pengeolaan BPJS. Hal tersebut menyebabkan defisit keuangan setiap tahunnya.
"Tetapi menaikan tanpa perhitngan yang jelas serta diperuntukan demi menutupi deifisit keuangan BPJS Kesehatan merupakan sikap keliru pemerintah dalam menghadirkan penjaminan terhadap pelayanan kesehatan," tutur dia.***

In front of Gedung Sate Bandung, students protested the plan to increase the contribution of the Health BPJS
05 Nov 2019, 08:09 by Novianti Nurulliah
BANDUNG, (PR) .- KAMMI (Indonesian Muslim Students Action Unit) rejected the increase in BPJS Health fees which was confirmed to be effective in January 2020. They rejected the rejection during a demonstration in front of Gedung Sate, Jalan Diponegoro, Bandung City, Tuesday 5 November 2019.
BPJS tuition which was originally Rp 80,000 for class I to Rp 160,000, class II which initially Rp 51,000 to 110,000, class III which from Rp 25,500 to Rp 42,000. The increase was triggered by the BPJS Health budget deficit.
In the banner KAMMI unfolded, they wrote, "We Refuse to Increase BPJS, BPJS Goes Up People Scream"
The action coordinator Fauzan said, the government must be responsible for the BPJS deficit without imposing it on the public. KAMMI urges the Government to Revoke Perpres Number 75 of 2019 regarding Health Insurance 3. KAMMI also urges the government to improve management and improve the quality of BPJS Health services.
"The increase in BPJS fees certainly burdens the public. The latest facts show that there is arrears on the contributions of BPJS Health participants because only 50.1 percent of the total independent participants routinely pay contributions, the remainder is in arrears. With the increase in BPJS participant contributions up to 100 percent, it has the potential adding non-active participants and of course will increase the arrears of health BPJS participant contributions, "he said.
According to him, before talking about increasing the premium of BPJS Health membership, the quality of service needs to be considered.
"At what stage does the government embrace all elements of service support for the achievement of health quality through BPJS Health, such as (many) clinics, puskesmas, hospitals that have not collaborated with BPJS Health and even cut off cooperation," he said.
This is important to note because health must be accessible to all people based on Law Number 26 Year 2009 regarding health.
He said, raising BPJS Health membership fees to the minimum limit of actuarial counts is an absolute thing that must be done because the income and expenditure of BPJS management is not yet proportional. This causes a financial deficit every year.
"But raising it without any clear attention and aiming to cover the financial de ﬁ ciency of the BPJS Health is the government's mistaken attitude in presenting guarantees for health services," he said. ***
